title: Can't log in ICloud, validation window doesn't appear
content:
Suddenly, I can no longer log in to iCloud on my MacBook Air from Firefox: I get the login alert and the code to validate the connection, but the window to enter the verification code doesn't appear. It says "enter" the code, but I don't get the window to do so!

I'm on Big Sur 11.7.10, it worked without a hitch for years. This laptop is one of my trusted devices. Is a recent update preventing the connection?

I looked at similar questions, and answers from 2020 said to add the 6-digit code after my password, but that solution doesn't work.

It seems the problem is with Firefox; it works on Safari. Any solution for Firefox?

Thanks

title: one drive "on this day" wont load/play
content:
I have contacted Microsoft. After testing the link/page loads in Edge, Chome (with and without addins same in ff) and Brave. But does not load in FF (with addon's disabled) nor in Private browsing FF (no addins obviously) they said to reach out to FireFox for support. See below for email exchange: FROM MS (most recent reply): Thank you for your response. We hope you are doing well. 

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and frustration this issue has caused, especially with the unexpected autoplay of music and the inability to exit the slideshow in Firefox. We completely understand how disruptive this can be, particularly in quiet environments or when you're on the go. Based on your detailed testing across browsers, it does appear that this issue is isolated to Firefox. Since the same content works as expected in Chrome (even with ad blockers enabled), the problem may be related to a recent Firefox. As the issue appears to be specific to Firefox, while the same functionality works as expected in other browsers like Chrome (even with ad blockers enabled). We genuinely want to help resolve this, but since the issue is browser-specific and not reproducible outside of Firefox, we kindly recommend reaching out to the Firefox Support Team for further assistance.  They may be able to identify any recent updates, settings, or compatibility concerns that could be affecting the page behavior. We are truly sorry for the inconvenience and are grateful for your understanding.

MY EMAIL TO THEM (in response to them saying try in edge private etc): Apparently this is a FIREFOX only issue?

I tried in edge (regular, not private) and it plays the stupid slideshow with music just fine, and I can get out of it and view the regular memory page that I want (Music really!? What if you’re viewing while someone around you is asleep? Or otp in public??? Smh) Chrome – WITH Adblockplus and Ublock Origin ON it works (not in private) > weblink gyazo video of it working with ublock and abp enabled…. https://gyazo.com/2afbdf7e27357a375ca7613b197f17ce Firefox – with adblock plus off, ublock off, and ghostery OFF does not work > weblink gyazo video of it just refreshing grey, black grey black and goes nowhere forever https://gyazo.com/8da9258f36457901df66f99e87fe7560 

Firefox – in private browsing (no addons) – does not work > weblink gyazo video of it just refreshing grey, black forever https://gyazo.com/f9119907e5127ede48797d9eacb1fed6 Since attaching a video to an email would be very large.. hope you can click outside links 😉

title: No puedo descargar archivos desde Gmail en Firefox
content: Cuando ingreso a mis dos cuentas de Gmail e intento descargar cualquier archivo adjunto, no pasa nada. Doy clic en el ícono de descarga y nada sucede. Si le doy al botón de al lado para imprimir el archivo, se abre una nueva ventana con el mensaje "La conexión ha caducado". Así mismo, las imágenes no me cargan en Documentos Google. A veces, por razones que desconozco, la descarga en Gmail sí sucede, pero no sé qué debo hacer para producirla, para lograr que el archivo adjunto se descargue; es completamente aleatorio y normalmente la descarga no tiene lugar por mucho que lo intente. Curiosamente, si quiero descargar cualquier archivo de internet (un PDF alojado en algún portal), puedo hacerlo sin lío. Este mismo problema me sucede en Google Chrome, pero no me sucede en Opera (desde este navegador he estado descargando mis archivos de Gmail desde ayer). Si me reenvío el correo de Gmail a Outlook, puedo descargar los archivos adjuntos. Sí, ya borré las cookies y el caché de Gmail. Ya intenté descargar un archivo con el modo de resolución de problemas de Firefox (es decir, el problema no son las extensiones y el tema de Firefox que estoy usando) y todo sigue igual. Estoy confundido. ¿Qué puedo hacer? ¿Tendré que pasarme de navegador a Opera para poder descargar mis archivos desde Gmail?

title: Seeing "Your browser is being managed by your organization" on a private Ubuntu computer, tar installation.
content:
This is one of the more annoying messages Firefox has recently added:

"Your browser is being managed by your organisation."

It is obviously wrong, because it is shown on a private Ubuntu 24.04 computer where I have myself installed Firefox from a tarball installation (Firefox version 142.0.1).

The about:policies page just shows: Homepage: URL "https://start.ubuntu-mate.org/" 

  Locked	false   StartPage	"homepage"

Why does Firefox give such obviously misleading information? All the other articles are not helpful at all either, some are talking about security software, some about malware.

This is an extremely user-unfriendly and confusing message: if security software is to blame, why does Firefox not tell what exactly is restricted? When malware changed something why does Firefox not tell what it changed? What even does the message actually imply, what is prevented what otherwise would work and why? What does the information shown on the about:policies page really tell me?

This is by the way shown when starting Firefox using an EMPTY directory for its profile (so making it use a brand new profile), running from a brand new installation directory extracted from a tar file. So what on earth makes it think it is "managed by my organization"?

There is no extension installed, no policies.json file in the newly created profile, nothing. It looks as if the firefox browser would just arrive with this weird setting/configuration comiled right into it?

title: Kannada Unicode ligatures (ottaksharas) not rendering correctly in Firefox 142.0.1 on macOS
content:
When viewing Kannada text in Firefox 142.0.1 (64-bit) on macOS [your version], conjunct letters (ottaksharas/ligatures) do not display correctly. Instead of showing combined forms like ಶ್ರೀ (shri), ತ್ವ (tva), ತ್ರ (tra), the characters appear split into individual glyphs.

This issue is browser-specific:

In Safari and Chrome, the same text renders properly with correct Kannada shaping.

In Firefox, the ligatures fail to render, making Kannada text appear broken and unreadable.

Apple Support confirmed that the system rendering is fine and advised reporting this to Firefox.

Example text (should be tested): ಚೊಕ್ಕಾಡಿ ಶ್ರೀರಾಮ ದೇವಾಲಯದ ವಾರ್ಷಿಕೋತ್ಸವ

title: Firefox freezes on Windows when the network device is restarted/reconnected or PC resumes from sleep
content:
Hi all.

This is a long message. I've tried to give as much info to reproduce a frustrating and re-occurring problem.

Firefox regularly freezes when my PCs resume from sleep. Multiple PCs, Windows 10 and Windows 11. Unfortunately it is hard to reproduce because it depends on a number of conditions and pages to be opened. I've had this problem with Firefox for many years now, easily since 2015. Because I normally only notice it when resuming from sleep and the combined problems, I've struggled to identify the exact trigger combination.

Has anyone else seen this? I will try gather debug logs next time it starts again. In the meantime, has anyone got a suggestion?

Troubleshooting attempts

  • Over the past years I have tried clearing cache, cookies, resetting FF, restarting the PC, starting FF in troubleshooting mode, disable and even uninstall all plug-ins, and much more.

Nothing solves it, but it is usually intermittent.

Problem trigger conditions • The problems seem related to when the network device resumes the connection. When the problem occurs after resuming from sleep, it can be reproduced when network connection is restarted. • It doesn't happen if I immediately sleep the PC and wake it again. That might be because the network remains 'awake' for a while. • It is highly dependent on the web pages open in Firefox at the time AND which Firefox window they're in AND the session in the pages that are open or something about the activity (scripts / session) on the page that is triggered when the network is re-established. • A combination will cause one or more Firefox app windows to freeze • Sometimes I can reproduce the problem 50+ times over two days in a row by restarting a wired network connection. Then the problem disappears. For example: ○ I found one Firefox window was freezing during a test, but a second empty one did not. I then moved all but the active tab (where I was logging this ticket) to the other Firefox window. The first page in the primary FF window kept freezing, but the other tabs moved to a new app window did not. I then move a "working page" back to the primary FF Window and the "problem page" to the other Firefox window, and the problem disappeared and wouldn't occur again. ○ This situation is quite common. With a combination of pages open, on the same PC, Firefox freeze everytime after resuming or the network connection is restarted, even with all pages "unloaded" from Firefox, so they shouldn't be doing anything. Later, I might close a set of pages when I'm done, and the problem goes away.


Environment:

  • Multiple Windows PCs over the past 6 or more years
  • Clean and upgraded operating systems
  • Windows 10 and 11 Pro 64bit, all with latest patches installed.
  • Firefox - always latest version. If Firefox is uninstalled and re-installed, the sessions and open pages are lost, to the problem is gone for a while, but then re-appears.
  • I use my Firefox account to sync everything: settings, bookmarks, tabs etc. between multiple PCs.

I also have Firefox on my Android phone, Samsung S24, also sync'd to the same Firefox account. I always sleep my PC with Firefox and other apps running, with many tabs open in FF.


Symptoms:

  • When it has frozen, Firefox app is the only one frozen. The other Windows apps work normally.
  • In Firefox, you'll see these symptoms: 
  - Nothing inside the FF window works, but if not full screen, you can move it around and all the content shows normally. You can also minimize and maximize the window from the Windows toolbar. It doesn't matter how many Firefox windows or tabs are open, all are hanging the same way.   - You cannot close Firefox from the toolbar.   - As you move the mouse cursor onto the FF app, the first cursor image set (resize icon or whatever) when it goes onto the FF app, is retained until you move the cursor off then app. Once off, the cursor is back to the arrow pointer.   - All Firefox windows open when it becomes frozen, remain frozen for minutes or hours, until you restart Firefox. (See how to restart below, without losing anything).   - You can resize the FF window by dragging the edges or corners. Existing content is cropped when you shrink the window as if it's a screenshot image being cropped. The content is not redrawn when you enlarge the window.

How to get restart FF without killing the app:

  • When the FF window(s) are frozen, you *can* open a new Firefox window by right-clicking on Firefox in the Windows toolbar, and choosing "Firefox" or "Open new window". That new window is full responsive and everything in that window and successive windows work 100%.
  • You can then close Firefox using ctrl-shift-Q (Firefox menu > Exit), which closes all the FF app windows.
  • Then, I can start Firefox again from the menu / pinned app and all windows open again as they were, with nothing lost. All the tabs open as well in each window, just as before the freeze. I can continue without anything lost except maybe session info. Even this partly typed message and session wasn't lost when I did a test.


I hope someone can help resolve this.

Thanks in advance. Brian
creator: iCaptnBob
